title: Two Powerful Blockchain Platforms of the Future: Ethereum and Solana - Paxos
summary: Two powerful blockchain platforms, Ethereum and Solana, are leading the charge in the technological revolution. Blockchain technology is digital ledger technology that documents transactions across a network of computers, offering transparency and decentralization. Ethereum and Solana have unique features and capabilities, with Ethereum being a platform for building decentralized applications and Solana being known for speed and efficiency. These platforms have gained popularity due to their ability to solve common pain points related to scalability, speed, and cost. The future of finance may involve instant transfers and more, with the potential to make hypotheticals into realities. Blockchain technology is evolving rapidly, and many enterprises need help adopting and maximizing its potential. With the right partners, businesses can stay a step ahead in the digital finance era.

title: Ethereum ETF hype spills over to Ethereum Classic, leading to 50% pump - Blockworks

title: Vitalik Buterin endorses raising Ethereum gas limit by 33% - The Block
summary: Vitalik Buterin supports raising Ethereum's gas limit by 33% to improve network capacity. Current limit is 30 million, set 3 years ago, and increasing it would allow more transactions in each block. Martin Köppelmann notes that this could lead to higher costs for nodes, but benefits outweigh potential issues. Jesse Pollak, Coinbase protocols lead, also supports the change. Unlike other changes to Ethereum, this increase can be achieved through validators adjusting their node configurations.

title: Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin calls for 33% increase in gas limit - Cointelegraph
summary: Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin has suggested increasing the gas limit by 33% to improve network throughput. The current gas limit is 30 million, and Buterin proposed increasing it to around 40 million. This would allow more transactions into each block, theoretically increasing the overall throughput and capacity of the network. However, increasing the gas limit also increases loads on hardware and the potential risk of network spam and attacks. Average gas prices are currently around 35 gwei or $1.89, but they have increased since the beginning of 2024 and are much higher for complex smart contract operations.

title: Pontem raises $6 million to enable Ethereum and Move-compatible apps - The Block
summary: Pontem, a web3 product development studio, has raised $6 million in a financing round led by Faction and Lightspeed Venture Partners. The funds will be used to expand the usage of the Move programming language beyond Aptos and Sui blockchains, and to develop Move Virtual Machine products on EVM-compatible blockchains like Ethereum, including the new Move-based Layer 2 Lumio. Pontem claims that its products on Aptos, including the Pontem Wallet and Liquidswap DEX, have garnered 40,000 weekly active users and up to $1 million in daily volume. The company plans to add support for other blockchain languages and the Solana Virtual Machine in the future.

title: US Lawmaker Mike Collins' $65K Ethereum Investments: Navigating Ethics and Market Dynamics - Blockchain.News
summary: US Representative Mike Collins disclosed investments worth up to $65,000 in Ethereum in early 2024, despite the STOCK Act allowing such investments. His actions raise questions about ethics and the need for stricter regulations in lawmakers' digital asset investments, as the market surged and political events unfolded. Collins' investments align with his prior digital asset investments, but the timing and intersection with political events highlight the complex relationship between government and financial markets, particularly in the realm of cryptocurrencies. This development reflects the growing integration of digital assets into mainstream financial practices and raises questions about the need for more transparent regulations to prevent potential conflicts of interest.

title: Fake Airdrop for Ethereum, Solana, Tron Users Carried out by Scammers - TOKENPOST
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Scammers are targeting Ethereum, Solana, and Tron users with fake airdrop schemes to drain their wallets.

The scammers create a webpage that appears to offer crypto rewards, but it's actually a phishing scam.

The modus operandi involves enticing users to link their primary wallets for access to the supposed airdrop rewards.

Scam Sniffer highlights that these fraudsters can drain various crypto wallets using this deceptive webpage.

The lure of substantial crypto rewards might mislead investors, potentially resulting in significant losses.

To stay secure, verify the source of airdrop updates and remain vigilant as scammers adapt and refine their tactics over time.
